intro: Dryandra nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathland environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
